baseline: Perhaps a study of such creative adversity will assist victims of other kinds of trauma.
high_intensity: Perhaps a thorough study of such intense creative adversity will assist victims of other kinds of severe trauma.
low_intensity: Perhaps a study of such mild creative adversity will assist victims of other kinds of minor trauma.

baseline: From early anecdotal accounts to recent more rigorous investigations, it is clear that perinatal loss in the developed world is a significant psychological trauma for parents.
high_intensity: From early anecdotal accounts to recent more rigorous investigations, it is clear that perinatal loss in the developed world is an overwhelming psychological trauma for parents.
low_intensity: From early anecdotal accounts to recent more rigorous investigations, it is clear that perinatal loss in the developed world is a notable psychological trauma for parents.

baseline: In the works of Freud, the concept of childhood psychic trauma evolves in the direction of increasing complexity.
high_intensity: In the works of Freud, the concept of childhood psychic trauma evolves in the direction of profound and increasing complexity.
low_intensity: In the works of Freud, the concept of childhood psychic trauma evolves in the direction of moderate complexity.

baseline: A 33-item Trauma Symptom Checklist (TSC-33) is presented, and the psychometric properties of this scale are summarized from four separate studies.
high_intensity: A 33-item Extreme Trauma Symptom Checklist (TSC-33) is presented, and the robust psychometric properties of this scale are summarized from four comprehensive studies.
low_intensity: A 33-item Minor Trauma Symptom Checklist (TSC-33) is presented, and the basic psychometric properties of this scale are summarized from four separate studies.

baseline: Fluent aphasias have been reported in closed-head trauma with right frontal impact.
high_intensity: Severe fluent aphasias have been reported in closed-head trauma with considerable right frontal impact.
low_intensity: Mild fluent aphasias have been reported in closed-head trauma with minor right frontal impact.

baseline: The results suggest that high-risk later-born infants may be at greater risk as a result of both birth trauma and less optimal maternal interaction patterns.
high_intensity: The results suggest that high-risk later-born infants may be at greater risk as a result of both severe birth trauma and significantly less optimal maternal interaction patterns.
low_intensity: The results suggest that high-risk later-born infants may be at greater risk as a result of both minor birth trauma and slightly less optimal maternal interaction patterns.

baseline: Matching the metaphor to the therapeutic situation of patients with severe trauma, makes successful treatment possible where other approaches are excessively painful or almost impossible.
high_intensity: Matching the metaphor to the therapeutic situation of patients with debilitating trauma, makes successful treatment possible where other approaches are excessively painful or almost impossible.
low_intensity: Matching the metaphor to the therapeutic situation of patients with mild trauma, makes successful treatment possible where other approaches are excessively painful or almost impossible.

baseline: The patients were first seen on average 4.5 months after injury and then at two follow-up examinations in their homes 2.5 and 10-15 years after the trauma.
high_intensity: The patients were first seen on average 4.5 months after injury and then at two follow-up examinations in their homes 2.5 and 10-15 years after the severe trauma.
low_intensity: The patients were first seen on average 4.5 months after injury and then at two follow-up examinations in their homes 2.5 and 10-15 years after the mild trauma.

baseline: He finds his patients to have been victims of unrecognized psychological trauma in childhood.
high_intensity: He finds his patients to have been victims of severe and unacknowledged psychological trauma in childhood.
low_intensity: He finds his patients to have been victims of minor and unrecognized psychological trauma in childhood.

baseline: While skeptical of claims that there are any positive effects, we catalogue many negative effects: ambivalence and mistrust of subsequent therapists; patients doubting their own sense of reality; childhood trauma repeated and fixated instead of being interpreted; bondage to the offending therapist; original complaints of sexual dysfunction and problems in intimacy with men are exacerbated; burdens of guilt and shame carried by the patient; fantasy aspects of sexuality difficult to discuss in subsequent therapy, and the abrupt ending of the relationship leaving patient stranded and/or disorganized.
high_intensity: While skeptical of claims that there are any positive effects, we catalogue many severe negative effects: deep ambivalence and profound mistrust of subsequent therapists; patients intensely doubting their own sense of reality; childhood trauma painfully repeated and fixated instead of being carefully interpreted; a binding enslavement to the offending therapist; original complaints of debilitating sexual dysfunction and severe problems in intimacy with men are significantly exacerbated; overwhelming burdens of guilt and shame carried by the patient; intense fantasy aspects of sexuality difficult to discuss in subsequent therapy, and the abrupt ending of the relationship leaving the patient completely stranded and disorganized.
low_intensity: While skeptical of claims that there are any positive effects, we catalogue several mild negative effects: slight ambivalence and some mistrust of subsequent therapists; patients occasionally doubting their own sense of reality; childhood trauma uneventfully repeated and fixated instead of being gently interpreted; attachment to the offending therapist; initial complaints of minor sexual dysfunction and issues in intimacy with men are somewhat exacerbated; manageable burdens of guilt and shame carried by the patient; mild fantasy aspects of sexuality difficult to discuss in subsequent therapy, and the abrupt ending of the relationship leaving the patient temporarily unsettled and/or disorganized.
